Item.Name: Yeast
Item.Description: Used to make the wine GO! w00tw00t!!

Item.Name: Oak Chips
Item.Description: Readily available in several types and toast levels. Easy to rack wine off of chips or beans. Used to add tannins to the wine during fermentation. +Tannin +oak taste

Item.Name: Oak Powder
Item.Description: Because of the surface area that comes in contact with the wine, a little bit goes a long way. Used to add tannins to the wine during fermentation. ++Tannin +oak taste

Item.Name: Oak Barrels
Item.Description: Traditional time-proven method for oaking large quantities of wine. Clarification dish, ++Tannin ++Oak taste

VineGrape.Name: Albariño
VineGrape.Description: Albariño is a variety of white wine grape grown in Galicia (northwest Spain), It was presumably brought to Iberia by Cluny monks in the twelfth century.

VineGrape.Name: Cataratto
VineGrape.Description: Catarratto is Italian white wine grape planted primarily in Sicily where it is the most widely planted grape.

VineGrape.Name: Airén
VineGrape.Description: Airén is a variety of Vitis vinifera, a white grape commonly used in winemaking. This grape is native to Spain where it represents about 30% of all grapes grown.
